definition: to detain/to hold in custody/to distrain/to seize property
button

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code
to mortgage/to pawn/to detain in custody/to escort and protect/(literary) to sign

sentences.english: The flexible member is attachable to the vibration source.
sentences.chinese: 灵活的成员扣押的振动源。

sentences.english: Mumbai police point the finger at 38 individuals, 35 of whom are yet to be apprehended.
sentences.chinese: 孟买警方指出38人中35人将被扣押。

sentences.english: They may seize and impound suspect products.
sentences.chinese: 他们可以查封并扣押可疑产品。

sentences.english: The court distrained property from him.
The government has confiscated the illegally imported goods.
sentences.chinese: 政府已扣押了那批走私货。

sentences.english: Their goods were distrained upon for rent.
sentences.chinese: 他们的财产被扣押以抵偿租金。

sentences.english: India detains DPRK ship off southern coast.
sentences.chinese: 印度扣押进入其南海岸的朝鲜船只。

sentences.english: The seizure of American hostages in Iran sharpened the pain of national humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗扣押美国人质的行动加剧了国耻的痛苦。

sentences.english: They decided to levy on his property to pay his debts.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定扣押他的财产以偿付他的债务。

sentences.english: None of the tourists were taken hostage, but the ship was seized along with its seven-member crew.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何游客被绑架，但是游轮和7名船员被扣押。

sentences.english: It shall not distrain articles that are not related to the case.
sentences.chinese: 对与案件无关的物品，不得扣押。

sentences.english: The type of AED and the dosage needed depends on the type of seizure.
sentences.chinese: 元的类型和用量需要取决于类型的扣押。

sentences.english: The creditors could sue or place a lien on a cardholder’s house.
sentences.chinese: 债权人可以上诉或者扣押持卡人的房子。

sentences.english: The children were detained as hostage in the underground.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们被扣押在地下通道里作人质。

sentences.english: The Tax Office wanted to levy on my house FOR unpaid taxes.
sentences.chinese: 因我未付税，税务局想扣押我的房子。

sentences.english: So can a site kick you off and keep your winnings?
sentences.chinese: 那么网站可以踢掉你并且扣押你的奖金吗？

definition: to detain/to arrest/to hold/to confiscate
to sequester/to seize (assets)/to seal up/to close down
to recover (illegally obtained property)/to seize/to capture/to force sb to hand over sth/to levy
to seize/to confiscate
(of a perpetrator, victim, weapon, sum of money etc) to be involved in the case
to recover (stolen property)/to pursue and force sb to give back the spoils
to arrest/to apprehend/an arrest
to transfer (a case, a person, files etc)
to destroy (by melting or burning)/to obliterate
booty/stolen property
subpoena/to summon (for questioning)
to arrest
legal (proceedings)/according to law
to arrest/to take into custody
inquest/trial/interrogation/to try/to interrogate
to detain (a prisoner)/to keep sb in custody
